chargeHist.descr: Endangering Safety By Use of Dangerous Weapon (Under the Influence of Intoxicant)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert De Leon Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: *  Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision and DNA fees to be paid prior to the end of the probationary period.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  Defendant shall not be possession of any firearms or weapons during the period of probation.
*  No new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.

*  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
*  AODA assessment with follow up care and treatment.

records.addlTxt:
Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
Box 678
cf
Reflects 03-10-16 Court order to remove requirement to submit DNA sample, but DNA surcharge is to remain assessed.

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED that the judgment of conviction shall be amended by removing the language "Defendant required to provide a biological specimen (DNA) to the State Crime Lab for testing." Signed and filed.
Per order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to Reserve Branch 4, for review. mag
DOC request to clarify order to submit DNA sample.

Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.

Defendant sentenced to serve 4 MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  Huber privileges under Sec.303.08 Wis. Stats. to apply for work and treatment.  

Court IMPOSED AND STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 YEAR with the following conditions as to probation:
*  No new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.
*  Cooperate with agent.
*  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
*  AODA assessment with follow up care and treatment.
*  Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision and DNA fees to be paid prior to the end of the probationary period.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  Community service of 100 hours.
*  Defendant required to provide a biological specimen (DNA) to the State Crime Lab for testing.
*  Defendant shall not be possession of any firearms or weapons during the period of probation.

Received and filed with court:
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form

Court VACATED the Jury Trial set for 03-16-2016.

Defendant waived rights and pled GUILTY.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Parties are prepared to proceed with Sentencing.

Defendant Robert De Leon in court with attorney Charles S. Blumenfield.  Maragaret A. Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   On motion of the State Court amended Count 1 from Endangering Safety By Use of Dangerous Weapons (Under the Influence of Intoxicant)  T0  Disorderly Conduct, While Armed under Wisconsin Stats. 947.01(1) and 939.63(1)(a) a Class B Misdemeanor.  Parties are prepared to proceed with a Projected Guilty Plea Hearing.
Received and filed with court.
State's Motion in Limine received and filed with the court.
State's Requested Jury Instructions received and filed with court.
Original DECISION Transcript (16 pages) commencing JANUARY 6, 2016 received and filed. kl

Defendant Robert De Leon in court with attorney Charles S. Blumenfield.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Based on all testimony and evidence presented in court, the court DENIEs defense Motion to Suppress Evidence.  Defense requests a final pretrial and jury trial date.  Court orders case adjourned to Branch 45.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 3, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for March 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Brief in Support of Defendant's Motion to Suppress Evidence and Statements, filed.
State's Brief in Opposition to Defendant's Motion to Suppress, filed.
Original MOTION HEARING Transcript (63 pages) commencing NOVEMBER 6, 2015 received and filed.

Defendant Robert De Leon in court with attorney Charles S. Blumenfield.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court ordered witnesses sequestered. Sworn for the state: Ofc. Lete Carlson, WAPD. Exhibits 1, 2 received. Tetimony closed. Case adjourned. Arguments to continue in writing. Written arguments due 12/15/15.  Decision scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Charles S. Blumenfield in court.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court waived Defendant's appearance for purposes of today. Defendant not in court due to a death in the family. Defense requesting an adjournment. No objection from the State. Court grant the request.  Motion hearing scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Robert De Leon in court with attorney Charles S. Blumenfield.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Matter before court for motion hearing.  Defense waives any prior objections to previously filed Amended Complaint.   Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty. 
For reasons stated on the record, case adjourned to Branch 46 for motion hearing.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Charles S. Blumenfield in court.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant's appearance was excused for this court date.  Amended Criminal Complaint filed.  Defense needs to review case law before deciding how to proceed in this matter.   Defense feels state may choose to dismiss or dismiss and reissue on next court date.   Court ordered case adjourned for a Juristictional Motion hearing in Branch 46. jks  Motion hearing scheduled for 05-13-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Robert De Leon in court with attorney Charles S. Blumenfield.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motions and a Brief filed by defense.  Defense requests a status conference to allow state to go through all filings.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 46.  Court will allow defendant's appearance to be WAIVED on next court date.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 46. jks  Status conference scheduled for 04-13-2015 at 01:30 pm.

DEFENDANT'S MOTION TO SUPPRESS EVIDENCE ILLEGAL SEARCH, DEMAND FOR DISCOVERY, MOTION TO SUPPRESS STATEMENTS, & MEMORANDUM BRIEF IN SUPPORT OF DEFENDANT'S MOTION TO DISMISS CRIMINAL COMPLAINT, FOR A FRANS-MANN HEARING, AND TO SUPPRESS EVIDENCE AND STATEMENTS, filed. jks
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Oral No Weapons Order  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 03-17-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defense counsel's Motion to DISMISS the criminal complaint was DENIED by the Court.

Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 46.vb
